data.text:
Short Film Exchange

The Galway Film Fleadh, Galway Film Fair, and NTA Film & TV are thrilled to offer live-action fiction Short Film Writers, Writer/ Directors, and Producers an exclusive opportunity to connect through one-on-one meetings on Sunday July 14th at this year’s festival.

Format:

One-on-one meetings where writers can pitch their scripts to producers in a speed-dating format.

Each meeting will last 5 minutes from approx. 2.00 - 3.30PM

After the meetings, participants will have the chance to mingle and continue conversations in a more relaxed setting over private networking drinks from 3.30 - 4.00PM

We also warmly invite other short filmmakers to join us for this networking opportunity from 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM. Please note, space for this wider networking reception is limited and guest must RSVP HERE

Schedule:

Meetings & Networking: 2:00 PM - 4.00PM

Wider Networking Drinks: 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM

Who Can Apply:

Emerging and established Short Film Writers, Writer/Directors, and Producers working in live-action drama.

Writers must have a short film script and project to pitch. Writers must have examples of work that has been previously produced and/or funded.

Producers must be actively producing short films, and/or short form content.

This is not recommended for new or entry-level talent to apply. Instead, new or entry-level talent is recommended to join for the networking reception.

The NTA Film & TV will meet the access requirements of the selected applicants, while adjusting the event accordingly, and cover the associated costs.

How To Apply (Writers)

Interested writers must apply by completing the linked form linked HERE

In this form you will be asked to supply a download (Google Drive or Dropbox preferred) link with the follow materials:

A synopsis and logline (or Pitch Deck) and Short Film Script for the project for which you are seeking a producer.

One and a half minutes pitch video. This video should briefly cover who you are, what the project is/is about and why you are seeking a producer. (Shooting this on a phone is perfectly fine!)

Media CV/work bio – detailing relevant experience

(optional but recommended) A personal statement (a written, filmed or audio-recorded statement) which tells us a little more about your background, expands on any other related experience, and speaks to how this development opportunity could help your career and/or professional development. (two pages or two mins MAX)

Please title each folder/document with your Full Name and documentation type. (e.g ‘SamKing.CV’)

How to Apply (Producers)

Interested producers must apply by completing the linked form linked HERE

In this form you will be asked to supply a download (Google Drive or Dropbox preferred) link with the follow materials:

Media CV/work bio – detailing relevant experience.

(optional but recommended) a personal statemen (a written, filmed or audio-recorded statement) which tells us a little more about your background, expands on any other related experience, and speaks to how this development opportunity could help your career and/or professional development. (two pages or two mins MAX)

An incomplete application will not be taken into consideration.

Deadline to apply is June 26th at 12PM noon.

Selection Process:

The applications will be assessed by a panel, which will include representatives of the National Talent Academy for Film & Television, Galway Film Fleadh, and independent external assessors.

This is an open application process, however in some instances the NTA Film & TV may work with industry stakeholders, including the Galway Film Fleadh and Screen Ireland, to identify talent who are ready to progress and encourage them to apply.

Approximately 10+ writers and 10+ producers will be selected to take part.

Further Information:

The Galway Film Fleadh is a week-long international film festival taking place every July on the western edge of Europe in Galway, Ireland. Founded in 1989 as a platform for Irish filmmakers to exhibit their work to their peers, the central goal of the Galway Film Fleadh remains unchanged: to be a platform for the boldest new films, and to bring audiences & filmmakers from around the world together, to celebrate our shared passion for film. The 2024 festival runs from July 9th – 14th

For any questions, please email filmandtv@nationaltalentacademies.ie and eibh@filmfleadh.ie

The National Talent Academy for Film & TV Drama is an initiative of Screen Ireland managed by Ardán.
